ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 14 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) data at 32 s Time Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The GOES 14 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) are essentially the same as the Energetic Particle Sensor (EPS) on GOES 8-12. There are two EPEADs on each satellite, one looking east and one looking west. For more information, please see Onsager et al. 1996, Operational uses of the GOES energetic particle detectors, in GOES 8 and Beyond, Proc. SPIE, Vol. 2812, edited by E. R. Washwell, pp. 281-290, Bellingham, WA. These data file contain mainly information on the proton fluxes from B detector. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA Office of Space Science Applications (United States), NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States), Terry G. Onsager

InformationURL.Name: GOES N, O, and P Brochure
InformationURL.Description: Information about the magnetometers onboard GOES 14

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 14 Energetic Proton, Electron, and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) Data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 14 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors data in CSV format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g13_epead_a16e_32s_20080301_20080301.csv, indicates GOES 13 magnetometer data at 32 s time resolution from 2008-03-01.

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds. Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags.

NumericalData.Keyword: Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors

Parameter.Name: Seconds of the Month
Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for protons with energies from 4.2 to 8.7 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of protons with energies from 4.2 to 8.7 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts/s of protons with energies from 4.2 to 8.7 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of protons with energies from 4.2 to 8.7 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 6.5 MeV protons from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove electron contamination.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for protons with energies from 8.7 to 14.5 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of protons with energies from 8.7 to 14.5 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts/s of protons with energies from 8.7 to 14.5 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of protons with energies from 8.7 to 14.5 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 11.6 MeV protons from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove electron contamination.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for protons with energies from 15 to 40 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of protons with energies from 15 to 40 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts/s of protons with energies from 15 to 40 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of protons with energies from 15 to 40 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 30.6 MeV protons from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove electron contamination.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for protons with energies from 38 to 82 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of protons with energies from 38 to 82 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts/s of protons with energies from 38 to 82 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of protons with energies from 38 to 82 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 63.1 MeV protons from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove electron contamination.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for protons with energies from 84 to 200 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of protons with energies from 84 to 200 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts/s of protons with energies from 84 to 200 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of protons with energies from 84 to 200 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 165 MeV protons from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove electron contamination.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for protons with energies from 110 to 900 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of protons with energies from 110 to 900 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts/s of protons with energies from 110 to 900 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of protons with energies from 110 to 900 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 433 MeV protons from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove electron contamination.
